info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 6 at 2:59PM CDT until September 6 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Los Fresnos, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, Laureles, Olmito, Cameron Park, La Paloma, Port Of Brownsville, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Rangerville, Brownsville, Primera, Combes, Lincoln Park, Library Memorial Middle School and Resaca Middle School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
